item.title: The gate was tied with a knot we could not undo so I cut it out. But the gate lock area was deliberately infilled with thorny bush offcuts we had to cut out first. It was a deliberate act to prevent access., 31st December
item.description:
The gate that leads out of the field next to the chicken farm was deliberately covered with thorny branches.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ashchurch Rural, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Request to put yellow lines on Shakespeare road to help bus route, 31st December
item.description:
At the moment there is no yellow lines on the side of Shakespeare road before the junction with Tennyson Road at the shops. As a result the bus which travels down Shakespeare road and turns left onto Tennyson Road can be blocked by cars when they double park. This happens often because of people visiting the shops from out of the area. The trouble with this is that local residents who know not to block the bus route by parking on the opposite side end up being asked to move their vehicle. If you put yellow lines at the end of Shakespeare before the crossing with Tennyson on the left hand side of the road nearest the copper beech tree this would solve the problem.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Shakespeare Road, St Mark's, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsditch Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham

item.title: Over 12‚Äù, large stones which hit cars and has caused damage, 31st December
item.description:
Outside number 3 Unwin Road. GL51 6 PQ. There are at least another three holes along the road from outside number 1 and just passed number 3. There are large stones being thrown up on to road and path as cars hit the holes. The holes have been there for sometime but are now causing a problem. Someone crossing the road could fall, twist ankle at the very least.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Firgrove Walk, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The drain is blocked problem, 31st December
item.description:
31/12/25 email rcvd (full email trail attached) ::: Dear Highways, The drain in the road on the opposite side to numbers 52-54 St Stephens Road, Cheltenham is completely blocked with mud causing problems particularly when there is heavy rain. The gully of the road leading down to this drain is now also now very muddy. I would be grateful if you could inspect and sort this problem. Thanks. Regards,
Report on FixMyStreet
